column4: can anyone help me with dual-booting....i have two IDE hard drives, ubuntu is on the master and XP is on the slave.  i have the bios set to boot from the master, where grub is installed, but when i choose xp from the list, it just sits there.
should be straightforward...done this lots of times before..
are you using chainloader +1 or whatever it is?
yes.
yes
maybe the boot record has been stripped off the xp partition
well, when i set the bios to boot directly from the windows drive, it can boot windows.
it just doesnt work from grub.
oh
no error messages, after it says 'boot' it just sits there.
the boot record for the windows machine might not actually reside on hd(1,0)
what would i do to find out
its possible its on hd(0,0) and scans the devices for other stuff?
how can it be 0,0 when that's my linux drive?

hmm, well, i know when SATA drives get setup for XP they need to have the boot record on the first IDE drive (if both are installed), maybe they require that the first drive have the boot record in _any_ configureation?
i have no sata drives or anything like that
i guess i'm not really sure why its happening. I've always heard that its _way_ easier to setup windows on the primary drive. Guess this is why. lemme think about it for a few minutes
all right, thanks, once1er
oh i just had a thought, you can actually use the windows boot loader to load linux
if thats a way you might want to go
i've never worked with it before, really.
http://www.geocities.com/epark/linux/grub-w2k-HOWTO.html
wow, something good actually came from a geocities site?!
it basically consists of copying the head off of your /boot partition, and giving it to windows
